greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of (q*j(q))^(1/24) where j(q) is the elliptic modular invariant (A000521).
comment: For k > 0, if mod(k,8) <> 0 then (q*j(q))^(k/24) is asymptotic to -(-1)^n * sin(k*Pi/8) * k * 3^(k/8) * Gamma(1/3)^(3*k/4) * Gamma(k/8) * exp(Pi*sqrt(3)*n) / (Pi^(k/2 + 1) * 2^(k/8 + 3) * exp(k*Pi/(8*sqrt(3))) * n^(k/8 + 1)). Equivalently, is asymptotic to -(-1)^n * k * 3^(k/8) * Gamma(1/3)^(3*k/4) * exp(Pi*sqrt(3)*(n - k/24)) / (Pi^(k/2) * 2^(k/8 + 3) * Gamma(1 - k/8) * n^(k/8 + 1)).
For k > 0, if mod(k,8) = 0 then (q*j(q))^(k/24) is asymptotic to exp(Pi*sqrt(2*k*n/3)) * k^(1/4) / (2^(5/4) * 3^(1/4) * n^(3/4)).
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..424
formula: This is essentially the eighth root of the theta series of E_8 (A108091), divided by the Dedekind eta function. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 08 2005
a(n) * A289397(n) ~ c * exp(2*Pi*sqrt(3)*n) / n^2, where c = -sqrt(2-sqrt(2)) / (16*Pi). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Mar 06 2018
mathematica: CoefficientList[Series[(65536 + x*QPochhammer[-1, x]^24)^(1/8) / (2*QPochhammer[-1, x]), {x, 0, 20}], x] (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Sep 23 2017 *)
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Apr 25 2005
